author: SavageSita
text:
1952, Alan Turing who decoded german's enigma code was chemically castrated for homosexual activities.

1954,  he was driven to suicide.

2014, he was granted royal pardon.

2021, he got featured on £50 note.

2022, he must be smiling down at the hypocrisy.

author: SavageSita
text: 7/7 Only you can fix your problem. Nobody else is going to do it for you. ❤

author: SavageSita
text: 6/7 Internet is gold. (I fixed the strings back by watching a YouTube tutorial).

author: SavageSita
text: 5/7 Getting embarrassed about committing mistakes is pointless.

author: SavageSita
text: 4/7 It takes time for the situation to turn in your favor.

author: SavageSita
text: 3/7 Rectifying the problem is the most constructive way of moving forward.

author: SavageSita
text: 2/7 It's okay to take a break and figure out ways to amend a situation rather than fretting about it.

author: SavageSita
text: 1/7 Bad moments, bad experiences and disruptive forces are inevitable.

author: SavageSita
text:
So during the #violintuning  in the course of #100daysviolinchallenge my violin's #Astring painfully snapped. Set of new strings arrived today, I desperately fixed it back. 

I learnt following #7Lessons from this entire incident: https://t.co/yJMWzPRxhE

author: SavageSita
text:
24 hours are enough! 
How? By being conscious about the places you spend your time.

7 hour sleep; 1 hour family time; half hour fitness and exercise; half hour on hobbies and passion.

Rest 15 hours on building a fulfilling life.

author: SavageSita
text: Slowly is the fastest way to get to where you want to be.

author: SavageSita
text:
These were 10 best tips from the first 5 chapters of this book.

If you liked it, follow @SavageSita1 for 'Part -2 Thread' on the gems of next 5 chapters from the book 'The Psychology of Money' by @morganhousel 
Tada!

author: SavageSita
text: 10/n There is no reason to risk what you have and need for what you don't have and don't need.

author: SavageSita
text: 9/n You need short term paranoia to keep yourself alive long enough to exploit the long term optimism.

author: SavageSita
text: 8/n Having an 'edge' and 'surviving' are two different things: the first requires the second. You need to avoid ruin. At all costs.

author: SavageSita
text:
7/n Getting money requires taking risks, being optimistic, and putting yourself out there.
Keeping money requires frugality, so past success can't be relied upon to repeat indefinitely.

author: SavageSita
text:
6/n Investing is a skill, but its secret is time. Thats how compounding works.
Its about earning pretty good returns which can be repeated for longest period of time. Thats when compounding runs wild.

author: SavageSita
text: Don't get too attached to anything. Your reputation, your accomplishments or any of it.

author: SavageSita
text:
4/n Success is a lousy teacher. It seduces smart people into thinking they can't lose.
The trick while dealing with failure is arranging your financial life in a way that a bad investment won't wipe you out so you can keep playing until the odds fall in your favor.

author: SavageSita
text: I want you to be successful, and I want you to earn it. But realize that not all soccess is due to hard work, and not all poverty is due to laziness.
